(Apparently this game has 150 weapons and considering Alfa's lineup, wouldn't surprise me, definitely gonna be something that takes a while to be finished. (Especially depending on how much Alfa weaponry was re-used.))

Revision as of 16:14, 29 December 2023
Work In Progress
This article is still
Hired Guns: The Jagged Edge is a 2007 turn-based strategy game, developed by GFI Russia and published by Matrix games with them also selling the game digitally on their Matrix Games Store. Notably Hired Guns was intended as "Jagged Alliance 3D" and even originally announced as such (with various in-game organizations clearly being Jagged Alliance organizations with different names.)
A large amount of the game's assets and weaponry are reused from the developers previous turn-based/real-time hybrid strategy game
[Alfa: Antiterror](/wiki/Alfa:_Antiterror).
The following weapons appear in the video game Hired Guns: The Jagged Edge:
Pistols
Heckler & Koch USP Compact
The
[Heckler & Koch USP Compact](/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_USP_Compact) appears on the game's map screen.
Submachine Guns
Heckler & Koch MP5SD3
The
[MP5SD3](/wiki/MP5SD3) is an available submachine gun.
[thumb|none|600px|The MP5SD3 in-game.](/index.php?title=ImageHiredGunsJaggedEdgeMP5SD3.jpg&action=edit&redlink=1)
Rifles
[Ruger Mini-14](/wiki/Ruger_Mini-14)
The
[Ruger Mini-14](/wiki/Ruger_Mini-14) appears as an available rifle.
QBZ-97
The
[QBZ-97](/wiki/QBZ-97) is an available Assault Rifle
